intro: Harpalyce cubensis, commonly known as Cuban harpalyce, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates. It has a low-growing habit and produces pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
